CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 3, 1958, p. 1, reads: "Slain in 'Old Folks Home' - ...Patrolman Alex Chenevaka escorts Joseph (Chef) Curd, 65, of Heldman St., suspected slayer, into a patrol wagon." Portions of accompanying article read: "Killer Says Victim Robbed Him Earlier. Fifty-six-year-old Arizona Simms, of 1824 Enoch St., was fatally wounded Monday afternoon by three bullets from the gun of a man who allegedly was settling a score for being robbed $17 by Simms a month earlier in same Wylie Ave. tavern, according to the police.  Joseph E. ('Chef') Curd, 65, alias Lou Terry of Heldman St., has confessed the slaying at the Hill Tavern, 1812 Wylie Ave., which is known as the 'Old Folks Home,' police say...  After the tavern shooting, Curd hurried from the scene.  He was arrested at Centre and Roberts by radio patrolmen Regis Larkins and Alfred Oglesby."
TitMainTitle: Patrolman Alex Chenevaka escorting Joseph "Chef" Curd (aka Lou Terry) into back of police wagon, outside No. 2 police station, Centre Avenue, Hill District
